text: Cloy Brook Pastures is a Site of Special Scientific Interest in the preserved county of Clwyd, north Wales. It is an area of wet pasture managed by grazing, with a variety of plants such as dyer’s greenweed, pepper saxifrage and spiny restharrow.https://naturalresources.wales/media/682572/nlca14-maelor- description.pdf ==See also== *List of Sites of Special Scientific Interest in Clwyd ==References== Category:Sites of Special Scientific Interest in Clwyd
title: Cloy Brook Pastures
